titleStmt.title:
An Ex- new Song being ye Intended speech of a
famous Orator against Peace

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: An Orator dismal of Nottinghamshire
Who has forty Years lett out his Conscience to Hire
out of Zeal for his Country, & want of a Place,
Is come vp, vi & armis, to break the Q────s Peace.
He has vamp't an old speech, & ye Court to their sorrow,
Shall hear Him harangue against Prior to morrow.
When once he begins. he never will flinch
But repeats ye same Note a whole day, like a Finch.
I have heard all ye Speech repeated by Hoppy,
And, misakes to prevent, J have obtain'd a Coppy

The Speech.
Whereas, Nothwithstanding, J am in great Pain,
To hear we are making a Peace without Spaine
But, most noble Senators, 'tis a great Shame
There should be a Peace, while J'm Not in game.
The D── shew'd me all his fine House; & ye D──s
From her Closet brought out a full Purse in her Clutches
J talk'd of a Peace, & they both gave a Start,
His G────e ·name. swore by ──, her G──e let a F:.t:
My long old-fashion'd Pocket, was presently Cramm'd
And sooner then Vote for a Peace J'll be d──nd
But, some will cry, Turn-Coat, & rip vp old Stories
How J always pretended to be for the Tories:
J answer, ye Tories were put in ye Good graces
Till all my Relations were put into Places.
But still J'm Principle Euer ye Same.
And will quit my best Friends, while J'm Not in game.
When J & some others subscribed our Names
To a Plot for expelling my Master K: James;
J withdrew my Subscription by help of a Blot,
And so might discover, or gain by the Plot:
J had my Advantage, and stood at Defiance,
For Daniel was got from the Den of the Lions:
J came in without Danger: & was J to blame?
For rather than hang, J would be Not in gam
J swore to ye Q──── that ye Pr── of Ha──r
During Her Sacred Life, should never come over:
J made vse of a Trope, yṭ an Heir to invite,
was like keeping her Monument always in sight
But when J thought proper, J alter'd my Note;
And in Her own hearing J boldly did vote;
That Her M── stood in great need of a Tutor
And must have an old, or a young Coadjutor:
For why; J would fain have put all in a Flame,
Because, for some Reasons, J was Not in game
Now my new Benefactors have brought me about,
And J'll Vote against Peace, with Spaine or wthout
Tho' the Court gives my Nephews, & Brothers & Cosins;
And all my Whole Family, Places by Dozens;
Yet Since J know where a full Purse may be found
And hardly pay Eighteenpence Tax in ye pound;
Since ye Tories have thus disapointed my Hopes
And will neither regard my Figures nor Tropes;
J'll speech against Peace while ·a nickname\followed seemingly by nam\. Dismal's my name
And be a True Whig, While J am Not in gam
